messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] help with a page, please
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry I was unclear and lost a link, too: Anyone with curiosity and free time is invited to help me edit a page I m working on here:
messages.messageBody:
Sorry I was unclear and lost a link, too:


Anyone with curiosity and free time is invited to help me edit a page
I'm working on here:
http://sandradodd.com/world

I'm combining two pages, http://sandradodd.com/local

and http://sandradodd.com/unschoolingotherwise

That second one is one of my oldest pages, and it doesn't make sense
to have it separate from local U.S. listings anymore.

===================



The help I'm hoping for is more links, better links to those that are
moved, and so forth.

Updating, I should've said, probably instead of editing.



Thanks,

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: help with a page, please
messages.msgSnippet: Anyone with curiosity and free time is invited to help me edit a page I m working on here: http://sandradodd.com/world I m combining two pages,
messages.messageBody:
Anyone with curiosity and free time is invited to help me edit a page
I'm working on here:
http://sandradodd.com/world

I'm combining two pages, http://sandradodd.com/local and http://
sandradodd.com/unschoolingotherwise
That second one is one of my oldest pages, and it doesn't make sense
to have it separate from local U.S. listings anymore.

Is Unschoolers of the Ozarks defunct or moved?


Are there other Canadian groups I should name, or are they all linked
through what's there?

And this:


-=-LDS unschooling is well represented on the web. The best and
friendliest link-rich portals I found were <A HREF="http://
home.rmci.net/abell/" target="_top">Amy Bell's page</A> and a sort of
online <A HREF="http://lds.about.com/religion/lds/library/conference/
blchildledlearning.htm" target="_top">conference</A>. <p>
There is an <A HREF="http://groups.yahoo.com/group/ldslearn"
target="_top">LDS discussion list</A>: "LDSLearn is a forum for
Latter-day Saint homelearners, natural learners, and others
interested in alternative learning approaches. All are welcome, but
be aware that most members of this list lean toward child-led
learning and attachment parenting." -=-


Only the first link is still good.
Does anyone know of any LDS (Latter-Day Saints / Mormon) unschooling
sites or lists that are current?

I don't mind discussing it on this list, or you can e-mail me on the
side, either way.


Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
